title: ACEF II Risk Score for Cardiac Surgery
description: Predicts 30-day mortality after elective or emergency cardiac surgery, incorporating age, creatinine, ejection fraction, emergency status, and pre-operative anemia.

ranges.interpretation: Consider optimization of comorbidities and careful monitoring.
Enhanced perioperative monitoring and risk-benefit discussion recommended.

references: Ranucci M, Pistuddi V, Scolletta S, de Vincentiis C, Menicanti L. The ACEF II Risk Score for cardiac surgery: updated but still parsimonious. Eur Heart J. 2018;39(23):2183-2189.
formula: ACEF II = age / ejection fraction + [2 if serum_creatinine > 2 mg/dL] + [3 if emergency surgery] + [0.2 Ã— (36 - hematocrit) if hematocrit < 36]
notes: Designed for elective and emergency cardiac surgery patients.
Anemia penalty applies when hematocrit is below 36%: add 0.2 points for each percent below 36%.
Higher scores indicate increased operative mortality risk.
